poem:
### The Return of Allan Leighton

In the aisles where time halts,  
and barcodes hold secrets,  
a man measures patience  
in quarters and halves of years.  
He whispers to the carrots,  
coaxes whispers from the bread—  
numbers dance in daylight,  
cans breathe a sigh,  
as fortunes unspool, aisle by aisle,  
under the flicker of fluorescence.
